text: I heard their coffee was great, but I only have their chai lattes! So good. Lunches are brilliant here too. All the sandwiches I've tried have been delicious. Also they have Pâtisserie de Patrice, which might be Montreals best treats.
Amazing new coffee shop. Super friendly, lovely design, great coffee, breakfast too! Just what this neighborhood needed.

Café 8 oz is where you will find me on a Saturday morning, monopolizing the corner with the electric fan and the plugs. The first time I went there, I was scared of asking for their WiFi password because, heck who opens a dope spot on Plaza Saint-Hubert? Well, Xavier, Claude-Sophie and her brother Raphaël are the kindest people... who make the tastiest sandwiches and salads of any coffee shop in this city.

Now I'm no coffee drinker so I have to talk about everything else.

Their menu changes every week so it never gets boring for any resident WiFi hoarder. Creative in look and taste, best toasted bread and fresh combinations.

For drink options, I get their green teas or their fantastic mocktails. 

And when I leave, I make sure to grab some pastries from Patrice Pâtissier: chocolate chip cookies or their banana bread with sunflower seeds for that sweet/savory kick. Da best.
I love this place! The coffees and atmosphere are a Montréal supreme example of the café done correct.

Parfait petit café pour aller travailler la semaine.

Il y a de grandes tables ou tout le monde partage l'espace. Petit bémol, il n'y a définitivement pas assez de prises ou de rallonges pour ordinateur ce qui fait qu'il faut prévoir le coup avant de partir. (ma charge ne dure pas trois heures alors on est mal partis, donc j'amène du papier). Props au café Moka qui est un HEAVEN ON EARTH et je n'exagère même pas. Amer et un cremeux, juste parfait.

A bientôt !

A friend and I went here for the first time. We had something very simple: filter coffee. We both decided it had a weird aftertaste, sort of like a chemical taste, or soap. Seriously, how do you screw up filter coffee? They did give me an allongé to replace the filter coffee, but they make their allongés like americanos: they make a regular espresso and add water. The allongé was decent. the weird aftertaste from the filter coffee lasted a half an hour. Not going back. 

(Rant) This is another one of those hipster cafes that look terrific but have a lot of trouble making a basic good cup of coffee. Their coffee comes from Portland Maine. Some suggestions: 
a) learn how to make a good cup of filter coffee
b) make an allongé coffee the way the rest of the province makes it
c) buy your beans from a Canadian roaster. This would save on shipping and support Canadian businesses.

This place is really charming! The interior is modern, playful, welcoming. I had a cheddar scone and iced orange-rooibos tea (made especially for me because this is not their usual iced tea). They were both delicious! It is on the expensive side, but I would say it is worth it. Staff is friendly. I really enjoyed the little play area at the back of the café. It is not a family-oriented place like "Tasse Gamine" or "Le Village", but it is family-friendly for sure. I was in there around 5pm, and it was nice and quiet. I want to go back and try their other foods and drinks.
A beautiful space, good coffee and a delicious chocolate chip cookie made this a real treat. It's a cool looking spot to hang out in too. The bilingual staff was very friendly. Soy milk available.

Simply amazing!

Awesome coffee and sandwiches! The staff is fantastic. They have a small terrace in the back during summer

A little secret - they also serve beer and wine - great way to end a day of work

Excellent café mais manque d enthousiasme  du propriétaire qui est aussi barista. On aimerait un sourire , un bonjour, pas qu'un air de buf ...  Il ne nous a pas donné envie de revenir... Heureusement que sa conjointe est parfois là. Elle a davantage le sens de la clientèle.

Beau petit (quand même grand!) café près du métro Rosemont situé sur la rue St-Hubert pas trop loin de la plaza. Mini terasse extérieure super adorable et puis le staff est super poli. Mon chai glacé était délicieux!

P.S. Il y a beaucoup de tables à l'intérieure pour accueillir plusieurs personnes.

Great café to work at and get things done. The coffee is good and the staff is friendly. When not working I like sitting next to the entrance window and people watch.
The playlist is pretty great usually and there's a nice book collection in case you need a break.

Deeply impressive coffee! Great place to buy fantastic filter beans from Tandem, a roaster in Maine, and to hang out, study, and have a snack. I'm slowly finding third wave coffee places in Montreal that don't insist on making every single coffee taste like an over-cooked chocolate nut bar and this place is definitely one of them. The people were also super nice and helpful in choosing beans.
J'y ai retrouvé une amie pour étudier pour la journée. On y a donc consommé plusieurs éléments du menu, tant en boisson qu'en nourriture, et j'ai été charmée!

Oui oui oui oui oui!
Un grand latte parfait. Aucun coût extra pour le lait de soya. La proprio m'explique qu'elle a toujours trouvé ça turbo aberrant, commander un latte amande et devoir payer 1$ d'extra. Les gens reviennent juste pour ça tellement c'est sublime comme idée, paraît-il.

Café Tandem pour les gens qui connaissent ça, pas ceux qui font semblant comme moi. Trop sensass, ouais! 

Étudiants, professionnels et familles se côtoient. Il y a des livres, une section avec des jouets, une grande table pour les groupes ou les individus particulièrement sociables et de plus petites tables. Amenez-y un(e) ami(e) pour discuter pas trop fort, ou votre laptop pour finir quelques corrections. Vous pourrez manger un p'tit muffin, un financier, un scone au fromage ou un EXCELLENT grilled-cheese. 

Toilettes propres mais non accessibles aux personnes à mobilité réduite. L'été, il est possible de prendre son café dehors, à l'avant du café ou encore sur la terrasse derrière. On s'y voit bientôt? :)

Great spot on a quiet section of St Hubert. They have really nice high table overlooking the street and a nice "terrace" in the back. Inside there is plenary of seating including a large communal table. 

As for the coffee, they serve coffee from Tandem, a great Portland roaster. I had the cold brew which was delicious. 

Bonus the folks behind the counter are great too!

I will definitely be back to try their espresso based drinks and the malted cold brew.

J'ai bien apprécié cette petite place où je suis entrée par hasard en la découvrant par le même fait (je ne suis plus de ce quartier). J'ai pris seulement un espresso mais il était très très bon et le latté art ça rajoute toujours un petit plus qui est l'fun. L'ambiance pour un jeudi après-midi était très sereine, genre d'endroit où je me sentais très à l'aise pour lire un livre et où certains discutaient calmement autour d'un café. Le décor est légèrement froid mais avec un côté galerie d'artiste/moderne intéressant. le café étant si réconfortant, ça fait un charmant contrate. Je retournerai volontier à cet endroit où le service était également bien sympathique et où on peut également casser la croûte.

Ajout: j'y suis venue une 2e fois pour y apprécier un cortado qui ma foi était bien intéressant. Bonne musique. Bon service. C'est décidé, je recommanderais cette place à des amis.
Bon petit café de quartier qui offre des sconnes tranquilité et sourire en entrant et un bon café.

Went here on a Saturday afternoon! Was full up! I was surprised to see how many people were studying and on their laptops, considering I don't find the area to be a student population...it made the vibe a bit quiet and less "fun"

They have a great bit awning out front with a few chairs as well!

Great latte and chocolate chip cookie, that was a solid half an inch thick! Total cost for both 8$

They serve up a unique blend of coffee (not 49th parallel)...which is what is served up at most plateau spots. 

Would recommend the coffee shop! But would not necessarily recommend traveling the length of the city to come here.
